headline: Why Strategy Stock May Never Make It Into the S&P 500
summary: Strategy missed the cut for admission into the S&P 500 Friday when three additions were announced—  AppLovin Robinhood Markets  and  Emcor  —and it could be tough for the big Bitcoin holder to be chosen.  The company looks more like an exchange-traded fund or closed-end fund than an operating company with ample recurring revenue and profits.  The company’s strategy is to issue equity—mostly common stock and some preferred—and buy Bitcoin, making it a giant repository of the cryptocurrency.

content.title: Why Strategy Stock May Never Make It Into the S&P 500
content.summary: Strategy missed the cut for admission into the S&P 500 Friday when three additions were announced—  AppLovin Robinhood Markets  and  Emcor  —and it could be tough for the big Bitcoin holder to be chosen.  The company looks more like an exchange-traded fund or closed-end fund than an operating company with ample recurring revenue and profits.  The company’s strategy is to issue equity—mostly common stock and some preferred—and buy Bitcoin, making it a giant repository of the cryptocurrency.

headline: Robinhood joining S&P 500, Broadcom & OpenAI, Duolingo coverage
summary: Yahoo Finance host Josh Lipton tracks today's top moving stocks and biggest market stories in this Market Minute, including the addition of Robinhood Markets (HOOD), Applovin (APP), and EMCOR (EME) to the S&P 500 (^GSPC) starting September 22; Broadcom (AVGO) inking a $10 billion AI chip deal with OpenAI; and Wells Fargo initiating coverage on Duolingo stock (DUOL). Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.

headline: Strategy Stock Drops on S&P 500 Snub. It’s Still a Buy, Analyst Says.
summary: Shares of  Strategy  were falling Monday after the  Bitcoin  -treasury pioneer missed out on inclusion in the  dashing hopes that would trigger a flow of investments from funds seeking to match the index’s performance.  While Strategy, formerly known as  MicroStrategy  posted a profit last quarter, clearing the final hurdle required for potential inclusion, it didn’t make the cut.  The decision won’t have come as a shock to seasoned investors, and it shouldn’t discourage those who have bet on the buzzy cryptocurrency company, argued Benchmark’s Mark Palmer, a longtime fan of the stock.

content.title: Strategy Stock Drops on S&P 500 Snub. It’s Still a Buy, Analyst Says.
content.summary: Shares of  Strategy  were falling Monday after the  Bitcoin  -treasury pioneer missed out on inclusion in the  dashing hopes that would trigger a flow of investments from funds seeking to match the index’s performance.  While Strategy, formerly known as  MicroStrategy  posted a profit last quarter, clearing the final hurdle required for potential inclusion, it didn’t make the cut.  The decision won’t have come as a shock to seasoned investors, and it shouldn’t discourage those who have bet on the buzzy cryptocurrency company, argued Benchmark’s Mark Palmer, a longtime fan of the stock.

headline: Robinhood joins new band of companies calling the S&P 500 their home
summary: Online broker Robinhood Markets will join the S&P 500 index after riding the popularity of cryptocurrencies to profitability and an all-time high stock price.  The company is set to join the benchmark index on Sept. 22, along with mobile technology platform AppLovin and construction company Emcor Group.  Robinhood is having one of its best years since going public in 2021 after struggling early on.

content.title: Robinhood joins new band of companies calling the S&P 500 their home
content.summary: Online broker Robinhood Markets will join the S&P 500 index after riding the popularity of cryptocurrencies to profitability and an all-time high stock price.  The company is set to join the benchmark index on Sept. 22, along with mobile technology platform AppLovin and construction company Emcor Group.  Robinhood is having one of its best years since going public in 2021 after struggling early on.

headline: Stocks tick higher after Wall Street flirts with another record
summary: Stocks drifted higher on Monday ahead of a week with several data reports that could dictate by how much or even whether the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates  at its next meeting in a week.  The S&P 500 added 0.2% and finished just below its record set last week.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 114 points, or 0.3%, and the Nasdaq composite climbed 0.5% to its own all-time high.

content.title: Stocks tick higher after Wall Street flirts with another record
content.summary: Stocks drifted higher on Monday ahead of a week with several data reports that could dictate by how much or even whether the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates  at its next meeting in a week.  The S&P 500 added 0.2% and finished just below its record set last week.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 114 points, or 0.3%, and the Nasdaq composite climbed 0.5% to its own all-time high.
